p: Removing highly correlated variables are recommended in predictive modeling [ 55, 67] as variables can be correlated and the combined effect may change the model’s performance, resulting in inaccurate and misleading predictions [ 68]. Pearson Correlation Coefficients (r) among 19 bioclim variables were calculated using ‘removeCollinearity’ function of the Package ‘virtualspecies’ (version 1.4-4) in R [ 69]. Variables with a correlation value of r ≥0.7 were excluded ( Supplementary material S1). This threshold level is an acceptable measure to minimize multicollinearity of the fitted models [ 68]. This resulted in variables into seven groups of intercorrelated variables. A subset of seven non-correlated environmental variables was selected for the model run ( Table 2). While selecting variables, special attention was paid to select variables that were highly responsive for a plausible forecast of species relationship to climate change and widely used in invasive species modeling literature [ 70, 71, 72].
